title: Cat. 89  Maoris and Animals, 1896/97
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Maoris and Animals  
1896/97  
Wood-block print in yellow ocher ink with gray-blue watercolor and touches of red watercolor on cream wove notebook paper ruled in blue; 91 × 106 mm (image); 106 × 133 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Print and Drawing Club, 1956.804  
Kornfeld 78  
For the verso, see fig. 89.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Victor Segalen (1878–1919), France.

Sold by Gerald Cramer (1916–1991), Geneva, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1956.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Richard S. Field, “Noa Noa Suite,” Burlington Magazine 110, no. 786 (Sept. 1968), p. 510, n. 23.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 262–63, cat. 78 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Collector’s mark lower right, in graphite (partially erased): VS [upside down]

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">His monogram lower right, in graphite (partially erased): VS [Victor Segalen] upside down.

The collector’s mark of Victor Segalen; see Provenance.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 89 Maoris and Animals, 1896/97.

fig. 89.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Maoris and Animals, 1896/97. The Art Institute of Chicago, 1956.804.

</section>
